mcqs.question: Which of the following characteristics is used to classify viruses?
options: Type and number of nucleic acid strands
mcqs.explanation: Viruses are classified based on their structural characteristics including the type of nucleic acid (DNA or RNA) and whether it is single-stranded or double-stranded. Viruses do not have cell walls, mitochondria, or perform photosynthesis as they are acellular.
mcqs.learning_outcome: Categorize viruses based on their structural characteristics, strand composition, associated diseases, and host organisms

mcqs.question: Bacteriophages are viruses that specifically infect:
mcqs.explanation: Bacteriophages (or phages) are viruses that specifically infect and replicate within bacterial cells. The classification of viruses by host organisms is one method of categorization.
mcqs.learning_outcome: Categorize viruses based on their structural characteristics, strand composition, associated diseases, and host organisms
